packagedElement.name: Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE

packagedElement.name: SecVulnerabilityScoringSystem
packagedElement.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringSystem

publish:property.name: Qualified Name
publish:property.publish:value: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringSystem

ownedComment.body:
A standardized method for vulnerability measurement and severity scoring.
Notes: Three scoring specifications have been created, one for each of the categories of system vulnerabilities defined by NIST SCAP. They include the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) which address software flaw vulnerabilies (introduced in 2004/v2 in 2007), the Common Misuse Scoring System (CMSS) which was designed for measuring and scoring misuse vulnerabilities. And the Common Configuration Scoring System (CCSS) which addresses software security configuration issue vulnerabilities.

ownedComment.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringSystem::<Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value: A standardized method for vulnerability measurement and severity scoring....

ownedComment.body:
A unique identifier for the SecVulnerabilityScoringSystem.
Notes: The three scoring systems are identified as CCSS (Common Configuration Scoring System), CMSS (Common Misuse Scoring System), and CVSS (Common Vulnerability Scoring System).

packagedElement.name: SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn
packagedElement.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn

publish:property.name: Qualified Name
publish:property.publish:value: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn

ownedComment.body:
The definition of a metric which may be categorized into three groups (Base, Temporal, and Environmental). These three groups are further decomposed into groupings for exploitability and/or impact which define metrics used to score vulnerability severity.
Notes: For example, Base Metrics are grouped into Base Exploitability and Base Impact Metrics. Base Exploitability Metrics include Access Vector, Authentication, and Access Complexity Metrics.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>
ownedComment.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn::<Comment>

ownedComment.body:
A word, term, or phrase by which the SecVulnerabilityMetricDefn is known and distinguished from other SecVulnerabilityMetricDefns.
Notes: The name for the metric may be assigned by NIST. Examples include Base Metrics, Temporal Metrics, Environmental Metrics, Exploitability and Impact Metrics.

ownedAttribute.name: scoringSequence
ownedAttribute.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn::scoringSequence

publish:property.name: Qualified Name
publish:property.publish:value: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn::scoringSequence

ownedComment.body:
The order in which the score for the metric is calculated. This ensures that a metric's score upon which another is dependent is calculated first.
Notes: For example, the Base Exploitability Score is calculated after the Access Vector, Authentication, and Access Complexity scores are calculated. Also, the Base Score has to be calculated from the Base Metrics before scoring the Temporal and/or Environmental Metrics.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>
ownedComment.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Enterprise Domain::Enterprise Risk ABE::Enterprise Security ABE::Security Vulnerability ABE::Security Vulnerability Scoring Definition ABE::SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn::scoringSequence::<Comment>

publish:property.name: Body
publish:property.publish:value: The order in which the score for the metric is calculated. This ensures that a metric's score upon which another is dependent is calculated first. ...

ownedComment.body:
A standard value for a defined scoring metric (SecVulnerabilityScoringMetricDefn). Each metric has multiple instances which represent multiple values.
Notes: For example, Base Metric Access Vector has three pre-defined values - L/Local, A/Adjacent Network, and N/Network.

ownedComment.body:
A narrative that explains the purpose of the of the SecVulnerabilityMetricValueDefn.
Notes: As an example, L (local) is defined by NIST per the CCSS Report 7502 as "A vulnerability actively exploitable with only local access requires the exploiter to have either physical access to the vulnerable system or a local (shell) account".

ownedComment.body:
A type of SecurityVulnerabilityMetricDefn that is formed by aggregating other SecurityVulnerabilityMetricDefns, which may be Composite or Atomic SecurityVulnerabilityMetricDefns.
Notes: A Base Score Metric which is made up of Base Exploitability and Base Impact, Base Exploitability made up of Acess Vector, Authentication, and so forth.

ownedComment.body:
A type of SecurityVulnerabilityMetricDefn that does not have any subordinate SecurityVulnerabilityMetricDefns, that is, an AtomicSecurityVulnerabilityMetricDefn is a leaf-level SecurityVulnerabilityMetric.
Notes: Examples include Base Metrics - Access Vector, Authentication, and Access Complexity.
